title.narrative: 1.6 H&N: IMMUNIZATION SUPPLY CHAIN SYSTEM STRENGTHENING FOR BETTER ACCESS TO QUAL

description.narrative: 1.6 Immunization Supply Chain System Strengthening for better Access to Quality Immunization Services, which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General, Polio Eradication, Research, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. By the end of 2022, most disadvantaged children have access to enhanced health and nutrition practices2. Sustained use of safe water supply and sanitation services, and adoption of hygiene practices, by children and their families in poor communities vulnerable to climate change, conflict and public health emergencies.

participating-org.narrative: CENTER FOR EDUCATIONAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
MINISTRY OF EDUCATION AND HIGHER EDUCATION

sector.narrative: Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.6 Immunization Supply Chain System Strengthening for better Access to Quality Immunization Services

description.narrative: Even during the multitude of crisis, UNICEF ensured continuation of routine immunization services, through system strengthening, partnership and collaboration with private sector.UNICEF ensured availability of vaccines through procurement of more than 1.3 million vaccine vials and needed consumable for entire immunization program and reached to 393,133 caregivers of children with key messages on routine immunization leading to vaccination of; 403,088 children under 5 at more than 800 public EPI points. To ensure quality of services, UNICEF conducted ;;the first EVM assessment and cod chain equipment inventory and strategizing for multi-year EVM Comprehensive improvement plans.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/12/2021
